page.title: 02NAILSTONE VILLAGE
page.content: {BUILDINGS IN THE VILLAGE} The oldest part of the{Church}dates back to the thirteenth century. The most recent restoration of the Church was in 1853. There are two{public houses}in the village, the Queen's Head and the Bull's Head. Opposite the Church is the old{Manor {House,}the rear wall of which is from the late fifteenth century.(1485){ {Smithy Farm}was the blacksmith's shop, originally built about 1787 on land owned by Lord Howe.{Crown Cottage}in Main Street, approximately 300 years old, is thought to be the oldest house in the village. The old{Infant {School}1828-1981 is now a private house and has been replaced by a new {Primary School}serving three villages. There is{Post Office}and general store on the old green.
